column1: Laohekou (Chinese: 老河口; pinyin: Lǎohékǒu; lit.: 'old river mouth') is a county-level city in the northwest of Hubei province
column2: People's Republic of China. It is located on the Han River (Hanshui)

column2: the city was the seat of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Laohekou.
four season humid subtropical climate (Köppen Cfa)
column7: humid summers. The monthly 24-hour average temperature ranges from 2.9 °C (37.2 °F) in January to 27.4 °C (81.3 °F) in July
column8: while the annual mean is 15.87 °C (60.6 °F). A majority of the annual precipitation of 830 mm (33 in) occurs from June to September. With monthly percent possible sunshine ranging from 33% in January to 46% in August
